item.title: Guess the number!
item.author: Author
item.description: Guess the number is a fun game that everyone played during our childhood. We can play it in solo with Python! Maybe it is not that fun but it can be used as an experiment. Aim: Guess the number that the machine thinks in the fewest steps! Let’s code togheter step by step! Firstly, we have to use a special library to generate random numbers. import random Then we proceed to create the main function of the game with the variables that we need:

item.title: Python for Psychologists
item.author: Author
item.description: Nowadays, computation thinking is a required skill and I think that to be a good recruiter in the tech industry, we as recruiters, should have some knowledge about coding and tech in general. This is why I want to start to post on this topics. Programming boils down to two basic concepts: input and output. You input data (e.g. text files, spreadsheets, lists of words, numbers, keyboard presses), and then write code which tells the computer to perform actions in order to output a desired result (e.
